availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Raised under an act of legislation dated January 1864 that allowed to Kentucky state governor to raise forces in defense of the state. Located in the southeastern portion of Kentucky. Headquarters at Booneville, Kentucky. Served from 1864 to July 17, 1865. Commander(s): Major Elisha B. Treadway.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1867), 780-91.
Senate Documents, 61st Congress, 2nd Session, vol. 59 (Washington: Government Printing Office, 1910), 30, 32.
